prompt: Process scanned Greek invoice with mixed Greek and Latin characters, extract VAT information, supplier details, and line items. Handle potential OCR errors in Greek text and validate business data accuracy.
expectations: Enhances existing deepread skill with Greek language processing
Correctly distinguishes Greek letters from similar Latin letters (Α vs A, Β vs B, etc.)
Extracts supplier VAT number (ΑΦΜ) and validates Greek format
Recognizes Greek currency formatting (1.234,56 €) and amounts
Identifies VAT rates (24%, 13%, 6%) and calculates totals
Handles mixed Greek/English text in business documents
Generates structured data suitable for accounting software integration
Creates searchable PDF with accurate Greek text layer

files.name: invoice_ocr_results.json

prompt: Process handwritten Greek receipt from restaurant with cursive Greek text, extract business meal information for VAT deduction purposes, and handle poor handwriting quality with confidence scoring.
expectations: Recognizes handwritten Greek cursive letters and connected characters
Handles restaurant receipt format with Greek business meal context
Identifies 13% VAT rate typical for Greek restaurants
Calculates 50% deductibility for business meals per Greek tax law
Provides confidence scoring for handwritten text recognition
Flags uncertain characters/words for manual review
Extracts date, amount, and merchant information accurately
Integrates with Greek expense categorization rules

files.name: handwritten_ocr_results.json

prompt: Process batch of mixed Greek business documents including government forms (AADE E1), contracts, and receipts. Classify document types automatically and extract relevant structured data for each type.
expectations: Automatically classifies different Greek document types with high accuracy
Processes AADE government forms with official layout recognition
Extracts contract terms and legal clauses from Greek legal documents
Handles multiple receipt formats from different Greek businesses
Maintains confidence scoring and quality control across document types
Generates type-specific structured data for each document category
Integrates with appropriate downstream processing (tax, legal, accounting)
Provides batch processing summary with statistics and flagged items

files.name: batch_processing_results.json

prompt: Process poor quality Greek document scan with image enhancement and OCR optimization. Handle faded text, skewed orientation, and mixed Greek/English content while maintaining accuracy standards.
expectations: Applies image enhancement techniques before OCR processing
Corrects document skew and orientation automatically
Enhances faded or low contrast Greek text visibility
Handles mixed Greek/English text appropriately
Maintains accuracy standards despite poor source quality
Provides detailed quality assessment and improvement metrics
Generates confidence scores reflecting processing challenges
Creates enhanced searchable PDF with quality annotations

files.name: enhanced_processing_results.json

prompt: Generate comprehensive OCR processing report for Greek accounting firm showing accuracy metrics, processing statistics, integration results, and improvement recommendations for monthly document processing workflow.
expectations: Compiles comprehensive OCR processing statistics for monthly reporting
Analyzes accuracy trends and improvement metrics over time
Provides document type breakdown with processing success rates
Identifies common OCR challenges and resolution strategies
Generates actionable recommendations for process improvement
Creates professional management report suitable for Greek business context
Includes cost-benefit analysis of OCR automation vs manual processing
Provides integration metrics with accounting software and workflows

files.name: monthly_ocr_analytics.json
